conclusion: To find the work done by the gas from state B to state C using the area under the PV curve.
Work done (W) in an isobaric process is given by W = P ΔV.
The process from B to C is isobaric with constant pressure at 0.6p0.
From the diagram, the pressure at state B and C is 0.6p0.
The volume changes from 0.5V0 (state B) to V0 (state C).
Calculate the volume change ΔV = V0 - 0.5V0 = 0.5V0.
Calculate the work done W = P ΔV = (0.6p0) × (0.5V0) = 0.3p0V0.
The work done by the gas when it changes from state B to state C is 0.3p0V0.
